verses.verse: God’s Compassion Despite Israel’s Ingratitude (Hos 2.15; 12.9, 13; 13.4; Mt 2.15) When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called my son.
(2 Kings 17.13-15; Isa 65.7; Jer 18.15; Hos 2.13) The more I (Gk: Heb they) called them, the more they went from me; (Gk: Heb them) they kept sacrificing to the Baals and offering incense to idols.
(Deut 1.31; Jer 30.17; Hos 7.15) Yet it was I who taught Ephraim to walk; I took them up in my (Gk Syr Vg: Heb his) arms, but they did not know that I healed them.

(Ex 16.32; Lev 26.13; Ps 78.25; Jer 31.2, 3) I led them with cords of human kindness, with bands of love. I was to them like those who lift infants to their cheeks. (Or who ease the yoke on their jaws) I bent down to them and fed them.
(Hos 7.16; 10.6) They shall return to the land of Egypt, and Assyria shall be their king, because they have refused to return to me.
(Hos 4.16, 17; 13.16) The sword rages in their cities; it consumes their oracle priests and devours because of their schemes.
(v 2|HOS 11:2; Jer 8.5) My people are bent on turning away from me. To the Most High they call, but he does not raise them up at all. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)

(Gen 14.8; Isa 63.15; Hos 6.4) How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, O Israel? How can I make you like Admah? How can I treat you like Zeboiim? My heart recoils within me; my compassion grows warm and tender.

(Deut 13.17; Isa 41.14, 16; 55.8, 9; Jer 26.3; Mal 3.6) I will not execute my fierce anger; I will not again destroy Ephraim, for I am God and no mortal, the Holy One in your midst, and I will not come in wrath. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Isa 66.2, 5; Hos 6.1-3; Joel 3.16) They shall go after the LORD, who roars like a lion; when he roars, his children shall come trembling from the west.
(Isa 11.11; 60.8; Ezek 28.25, 26) They shall come trembling like birds from Egypt and like doves from the land of Assyria, and I will return them to their homes, says the LORD.
(Hos 4.2; 7.3) (12.1 in Heb) Ephraim has surrounded me with lies and the house of Israel with deceit, but Judah still walks (Heb roams or rules) with God and is faithful to the Holy One.
